{"step_by_step_thinking": "A temporary bridge is a provisional or interim bridge that is placed to protect the prepared teeth while the final, permanent bridge is being made. It is usually made from a synthetic resin. A. This is not necessarily true. Even if a missing tooth is provided on a partial denture, a temporary bridge may still be required to protect the prepared teeth. B. Polycarboxylate cement is not typically used for temporary bridges. Temporary bridges are usually cemented with a temporary cement that is easy to remove. C. The temporary bridge does not necessarily need to have the same buccal and lingual contours as the permanent bridge. The main purpose of the temporary bridge is to protect the prepared teeth and maintain the space, not to replicate the exact shape of the final restoration. D. The temporary bridge should restore the occlusion to the same extent as the permanent bridge. This is important to maintain the patient's bite and prevent any changes in the occlusion.", "answer_choice": "D"}
